name: County of Imperial, California v. Munoz
Barrentine v. Arkansas-Best Freight System, Inc.
Delta Air Lines, Inc. v. August
J. Truett Payne Company, Inc. v. Chrysler Motors Corporation
Federal Communications Commission v. WNCN Listeners Guild
San Diego Gas & Electric Company v. City of San Diego
New York v. Belton
question: May an officer lawfully search a car without a warrant after the occupants are separated from the vehicle and under arrest?

name: Federal Trade Commission v. Standard Oil Company of California
City of Newport v. Fact Concerts, Inc.
California Medical Association v. Federal Election Commission
Universities Research Assn., Inc. v. Coutu
Texas Industries, Inc. v. Radcliff Materials, Inc.
Flynt v. Ohio
question: Can the Supreme Court assume jurisdiction over a case that has not received final judgment?
description: A case in which the Court decided that it cannot assume jurisdiction over a case that has not received final judgment unless the lower decision seriously erodes a federal policy.

name: Potomac Elec. Power Co. v. Director, Office of Workers' Compensation Programs
Florida Department of Health and Rehabilitative Services v. Florida Nursing Home Association
United States Postal Service v. Council of Greenburgh Civic Associations
Democratic Party of United States v. Wisconsin ex rel. La Follette
question: Can a state compel a National Party Convention to admit delegates from its state if those delegates were selected in a manner violating the National Party's rules?

name: Chandler v. Florida
question: Does allowing radio, television, and still photographic coverage of a criminal trial for public broadcast violate the accused's right to a fair trial as guaranteed by the Sixth and Fourteenth Amendments?

name: H. A. Artists & Associates, Inc. v. Actors' Equity Assn.
Webb's Fabulous Pharmacies Inc. v. Beckwith
American Textile Mfrs. Institute, Inc. v. Donovan
question: Does the Occupational Safety and Health Act require OSHA to demonstrate that the reduction of risk is significant enough to offset the costs of adopting a new standard?
description: A case in which the Court held that the language of the Occupational Safety and Health Act requires the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to engage in feasibility analysis but not a cost-benefit analysis.

name: Steagald v. United States
question: Does the Fourth Amendment prevent police officers from searching for a suspect in the home of a third party without obtaining a warrant?

name: Texas Department of Community Affairs v. Burdine
question: After an employee has proven a prima facie case of discrimination treatment, does the burden shift to the defendant to persuade the court of the nondiscriminatory reasons for the termination of the employee?
description: A case that held that the defendant bears the burden of proof to provide nondiscriminatory reasons for termination after a former employee has proven a prima facie case that the termination violated the Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.

name: Pennhurst State School and Hospital v. Halderman
Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System v. Investment Company Institute
Thomas v. Review Board of the Indiana Employment Security Division
question: Does the Free Exercise Clause require a state to provide unemployment compensation benefits to an employee who quit because of a belief that his religion prohibited him from engaging in the employer's line of work?

name: Schad v. Borough of Mount Ephraim
United States v. Morrison
question: Did the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit wrongfully dismiss criminal charges on the ground that the defendant's Sixth Amendment right to counsel was violated in a way that had no tangible effect upon court proceedings?

name: National Labor Relations Board v. Amax Coal Company
Arkansas Louisiana Gas Company v. Hall
Lassiter v. Department of Social Services
question: Did the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment require North Carolina to provide Abby Gail Lassiter with counsel in a proceeding to permanently and irrevocably terminate her parental rights?

name: Complete Auto Transit, Inc. v. Reis
Western & Southern Life Ins. Co. v. State Bd. of Equalization of Cal.
Minnesota v. Clover Leaf Creamery Company
question: Did the Minnesota statute violate the Commerce clause of Article I or the Equal Protection clause of the Fourteenth Amendment?

name: United States v. Will
question: Did the congressional acts between 1976 and 1979 violate the Constitution's Compensation Clause of Article III?

name: Environmental Protection Agency v. National Crushed Stone Association
Rostker v. Goldberg
question: Did the MSSA's gender distinctions violate the Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment?

name: Middlesex County Sewerage Authority v. National Sea Clammers Association
Commissioner of Internal Revenue v. Portland Cement Company of Utah
Northwest Airlines, Inc. v. Transport Workers Union of America, AFL-CIO
Michigan v. Summers
question: Did the officers have the authority under the Fourth Amendment to detain Summers while they executed a warrant to search his house for heroin and other contraband?
description: A case in which the Court held that a warrant to search for contraband grants police officers the limited authority to detain occupants of a house during the search of the premises.

name: National Gerimedical Hospital and Gerontology Center v. Blue Cross of Kansas City
United Association of Journeymen & Apprentices of the Plumbing & Pipefitting Industry v. Local 334, United Association of Journeymen & Apprentices of the Plumbing & Pipefitting Industry
Stone v. Graham
question: Did the Kentucky statute violate the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment?
description: A case in which the Court ruled that a Kentucky statute requiring each public school classroom in the state to include a copy of the Ten Commandments violated the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment.

name: Allied Chemical Corporation v. Daiflon, Inc.
Walter Fleisher Co. v. County of Los Angeles
Michael M. v. Superior Court of Sonoma County
question: Did California's statutory rape law unconstitutionally discriminate on the basis of gender?

name: First National Maintenance Corporation v. National Labor Relations Board
Haig v. Agee
question: Did the President, acting through the Secretary of State, have the constitutional authority to revoke the passport?

name: Minnick v. California Department of Corrections
Diamond v. Diehr
question: Can one patent a machine that transforms materials physically under the control of a programmed computer?

name: Clayton v. International Union, United Automobile, Aerospace & Agricultural Implement Workers of America
Consolidated Rail Corporation v. National Association of Recycling Industries, Inc.
United States Railroad Retirement Board v. Fritz
question: Does the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 violate the Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment by creating irrational distinctions between employees?

name: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission v. Associated Dry Goods Corporation
Ford Motor Credit Company v. Cenance
Steadman v. Securities and Exchange Commission
Metromedia, Inc. v. City of San Diego
question: Does a city ban on "offsite" outdoor advertising signs violate First and Fourteenth Amendment provisions for free speech?

name: Connecticut Bd. of Pardons v. Dumschat
Immigration and Naturalization Service v. Jong Ha Wang
Robbins v. California
question: May police officers search closed containers found during a lawful, warrantless search of an automobile?

name: United Parcel Service, Inc. v. Mitchell
Heffron v. International Soc. for Krishna Consciousness, Inc.
question: May a state, consistent with the First and Fourteenth Amendments, confine religious organizations wishing to sell and distribute religious literature at a state fair to an assigned location within the fairgrounds?

name: Dames & Moore v. Regan
question: Did the president have the authority to transfer Iranian funds and to nullify legal claims against Iran?

name: Kassel v. Consolidated Freightways Corporation of Delaware
question: Did the law pose an unconstitutional burden on interstate commerce?

name: Staats v. Bristol Laboratories Div. of Bristol-Myers Co.
New York State Liquor Authority v. Bellanca
National Labor Relations Board v. Amax Coal Company
Rowan Cos., Inc. v. United States
United States v. Louisiana (Louisiana Boundary Case)
CBS, Inc. v. Federal Communications Commission
question:
1. Did the Federal Communications Act create a new, individual right of broadcast access for the Carter-Mondale Presidential Committee, as the representatives of a candidate for federal office?

2. Did the act authorize the Federal Communications Commission to determine the beginning of the 1980 presidential campaign for purposes of the act and to assess the specific broadcast needs of the CMPC?

3. Did CBS have the right to decline to sell thirty minutes of broadcast time to the CMPC under the First Amendment?

name: Federated Department Stores, Inc. v. Moitie
Watkins v. Sowders
question: Is a state criminal trial court constitutionally compelled to conduct a hearing outside the presence of the jury whenever a defendant contends that a witness’ identification was improper?
description: A case in which the Court concluded that the Due Process Clause does not require a judicial determination of admissibility of identification, though it is advisable.

name: Scindia Steam Navigation Company, Ltd. v. Santos
St. Martin Evangelical Lutheran Church v. South Dakota
United States v. Maine (Massachusetts Boundary Case)
Chicago & North Western Transportation Company v. Kalo Brick & Tile Company
Gulf Offshore Company v. Mobil Oil Corporation
Hodel v. Virginia Surface Mining & Reclamation Association, Inc.
Firestone Tire & Rubber Company v. Risjord
